author: Sterfam

text:
Magmoor Caverns this place can get pretty rough
Magmoor caverns is hotter than Hillary Duff
You may think that this place sucks, but that is your loss
Only problem really that there is no boss
Auto Defense Turrets will shoot your ass down
Most of what you see will be red, orange and brown
(Ya' know IN THE BATHROOM)
If you think you're safe well you'd better stop
You'll get burnt by Magmoors, Puffers and Triclops
Magmoor caverns is the center from which all worlds can be entered.

God I love NCS
author: Kindekuma

text: My favorite song in the game. I played Metroid Prime first, so when I played this game, I was like... "Oh, so THAT'S where the awesome Magmoor Caverns song came from!"

text: Oh Metroid... In most games you can like, anticipate what's going to come next, you seriously cannot do so in this series.
author: GalaxySoldier

text: Super Metroid had excellent music which was able to add to the atmosphere, It's only weird how you got only 4 soundtracks of the game on your list. I hope we will see more from Super Metroid in the future.
author: Happytreefriendsfan3

text:
Well I just got similar vibes from Shadow of the Colossus (minus the claustrophobic part).

But yeah, Super Metroid is right up there with The Wind Waker and SOTC for being some of the best games to provide a "sense of discovery".

author: Matt 6418

text: It's a livin'!  Well, aside from that, I'd say that this music really helped me not lose my patience the first time I got here.  I was fighting the metal space pirates with no plasma beam and about 7 energy tanks and they kicked my ass every time.  Now, I can wipe the floor with them. I'm usually here in about an hour and a half of play at most ready to make this place a cakewalk.  This is my favourite song in Super Metroid. *slight nerdrage to those that consider this the Magmoor Caverns theme*

text: You knew you were in for some lava filled adventure when you entered Norfair's lower sector and this track started playing. Super Metroid is a mastepiece and no other game hasï»¿ ever given me such a claustrophobic but open-world experience (Dark Souls came close). The feeling of discovering and taking an elevator to an unknown and always deeper area was unmatched.
